byline.original: By FRED R. CONRAD and KERRI MACDONALD

abstract: Charles M. Conlon has been deemed "the greatest baseball photographer." Fred R. Conrad and Kerri MacDonald talked with Connie McCabe, a photograph conservator who worked on the second book of Mr. Conlon's pictures.
snippet: Charles M. Conlon has been deemed "the greatest baseball photographer." Fred R. Conrad and Kerri MacDonald talked with Connie McCabe, a photograph conservator who worked on the second book of Mr. Conlon's pictures.
lead_paragraph: Charles M. Conlon has been deemed - on Lens, if not elsewhere - "the greatest baseball photographer." From 1904 to 1942, Mr. Conlon shot some 30,000 pictures of America's pastime. In 1993, The Sporting News published "Baseball's Golden Age," a collection of his work.

headline.main: Another Productive At-Bat for a 'Golden Age'
